Description: Iraq invades Kuwait leading to supply disruptions and oil price spikes.
Supply disruptions in Asia leading to short-term price spikes.
Economic downturn reduces oil demand in Asia, affecting prices.
Strike reduces Venezuelan oil output, tightening supply.
US-led invasion causes uncertainty and price volatility in oil markets.
Severe storm disrupts Gulf oil production and refining capacity.
Worldwide recession leads to sharp fall in oil demand and prices.
Rapid growth in US shale oil production disrupts global markets.
Conflict halts oil exports and increases price uncertainty.
Supply glut and OPEC decision not to cut output causes price collapse.
Sanctions eased, Iranian oil re-enters global market affecting supply.
OPEC agrees to cut production to stabilize falling oil prices.
Largest IPO boosts Saudi oil sector investment outlook.
Global lockdowns cause dramatic drop in oil demand and prices.
Conflict triggers sanctions and supply uncertainty, raising oil prices.
